p: Up to now, the most successful vaccines against microbial pathogens have depended on humoral immunity to achieve protection or even sterile eradication. However, the intracellular bacteria Mycobacterium bovis (M. bovis), which produces tuberculosis (TB), is able to resist most antibody-mediated antibacterial effects by growing inside macrophages ( 44). Thus, the induction of a cell-mediated immune response to kill the infected cells is crucial to develop an anti-TB vaccine.
